newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Argentine Finance Min to travel to Brazil.
newsitem.headline: Argentine Finance Min to travel to Brazil.

text.p: Argentine Finance Minister Roque Fernandez will travel to Brasilia on Wednesday for talks on Brazil's new import financing rules, an Argentine official said.
"Tomorrow Minister Fernandez will come to Brasilia to hopefully complete talks," said Andres Cisneros, deputy Foreign Minister told reporters.
When asked if Brazil might excenpt Mercosur countries from the new rules, Cisneros said: "That is one of the subjects that is being discussed."
Argentine ambassador to Brazil Diego Guelar said Fernandez and Brazil Finance Minister Pedro Malan would lunch together and then hold a news conference at 1500 local/1800 gmt.
Sebastiao do Rego Barros, Brazilian deputy Foreign Minister, said the two sides were discussing, "something that is extendable to all of Mercosur."

Facing a widening trade deficit, Brazil last Tuesday revealed new rules forcing importers with financing of less than 360 days to buy their foreign exchange on the day they pick their goods up from customs.
Brazil's Mercosur partners, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, reacted furiously to the limit on short term import financing, which they termed "protectionist."
Fernandez had been due in Brasilia on Tuesday, but postponed the trip saying the two sides remained too far apart.
Asked if Fernandez's decision to come on Wednesday meant progress had been made Rego Barros said: "You can draw your own conclusions."
